channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.description: The former White House adviser was arrested on charges that he and three others ripped off donors to an online fundraising scheme "We Build The Wall".
item.title: Steve Bannon arrested in alleged fraud scheme linked to border wall

item.description: The French health ministry reported 4711 new coronavirus infections in 24 hours, a new post-lockdown record and a level last seen during the height of the epidemic in France.
item.title: France records more than 4700 virus infections in post-lockdown daily record

item.description: Alexei Navalny is in a coma in hospital, after his supporters suspect his tea was poisoned at an airport cafe shortly before he boarded a flight.
item.title: 'My death wouldn't help Putin', rival said before suspected tea poisoning

item.description: A series of large fires are raging through Northern California, threatening thousands of homes and blackening the skies near San Francisco.
item.title: Northern California fires threaten thousands of homes

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: The Great Barrier Reef was showing only modest recovery in coral cover before it was hammered by its third mass bleaching event in five years, the latest annual survey by the Australian Institute of Marine Science reveals.
item.title: Great Barrier Reef showed modest recovery before latest bleaching, survey finds

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: Principals and psychologists say schools should be allowed to develop COVID-safe graduation events with parents, rather than have them banned altogether.
item.title: 'A really tough year': Calls for COVID-safe graduations as year 12 suffers

item.description: The commitment of the National Farmers Federation to the reduction of emissions is an indication that people who work on the land want to save the planet.
item.title: Everyone gets the climate crisis - except the PM

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: NSW is losing $73 million a week because of the Victorian border closure.
item.title: NSW's $73 million weekly hit to economy from Victoria border closure

item.dc:creator: Georgina Robinson
item.description: All the ins and outs of Dave Rennie's Wallabies contenders as the Super Rugby AU season reaches the pointy end.
item.title: Waratahs rocket up rankings in Wallabies coach's watch list

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: Two NSW security companies have been investigated after an audit found the companies had been illegally subcontracting some of their hotel quarantine security work.
item.title: Two NSW hotel quarantine security companies investigated for illegal subcontracting

item.description: An eight-race Livermore Cup card on the mid north coast wraps up the working week for Racing NSW.
item.title: Race-by-race tips and preview for Taree on Friday

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: A busy crossroads in Brisbane's inner north had claimed the unwanted title of the most dangerous intersection in the state for a second year in a row.
item.title: Queensland's top 10 most dangerous intersections

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Ben Hunt says the Dragons would be best off chasing an experienced coach, and why he'd have no dramas working with Wayne Bennett again.
item.title: Dragons $6m man says Red V should go on Hunt for experienced coach

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: Australia's largest energy generator has announced its first concrete steps in shutting down its Liddell power station, pre-empting a government taskforce.
item.title: AGL forges ahead of Morrison government on Liddell coal plant shut down

item.dc:creator: Cameron Houston
item.description: A victim of one of Victoria's most notorious paedophile priests accuses law firm Slater and Gordon of bungling his compensation claim against the Catholic Church, which paid out $75,000 for horrific sexual abuse.
item.title: Clerical abuse victim sues Slater and Gordon over church payout

item.dc:creator: Nick O'Malley
item.description: The Bob Brown Foundation hopes to end native forest logging in Tasmania in a lawsuit that might serve as a blow to the industry across the country.
item.title: Bob Brown lawsuit aims to end Tasmanian native forest logging

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: The Greens Leader says the 'only time that climate pollution meaningfully dropped is when the Greens shared power'.
item.title: Adam Bandt urges another Labor-Greens coalition for climate action

item.dc:creator: Karl Quinn
item.description: COVID-19 forced the Melbourne International Film Festival online and it has proven to be a winner with audiences near and far.
item.title: MIFF audience numbers way up as digital-only festival proves a huge hit

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: Australia's fisheries and aquaculture industries will receive up to six months' warning of damaging marine heatwaves under a new national forecasting system.
item.title: Marine heatwave early warning system for aquaculture industry

item.description: To justify pausing the increase in the superannuation guarantee at a rate of 10 per cent, retirees need the assurance of a regular payment they can spend - no matter how long they live.
item.title: It’s time to help seniors spend more of their retirement savings

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Friday, August 21

item.dc:creator: Rosalind Dixon
item.description: The Deputy NSW Premier thinks it's time to ease the border restrictions, but that ignores the overwhelming evidence: it is the coronavirus, not lockdowns or border closures, that kills business and consumer confidence.
item.title: Bordering on dangerous: the economic case against opening states

item.description: Lonely leaders are contagious - and in this fact presents challenges in the COVID era.
item.title: Loneliness at work: a hidden menace

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: Labor politicians want one of Brisbane City Council's green bridges to be built east of the Story Bridge, but that could be costly.
item.title: Why a green bridge east of the Story Bridge is a challenge

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: Tough travel restrictions could shave $117 billion off the economy over the next decade, leaving each Australian $2850 a year worse off, unless a vaccine is found and widely distributed within two years, analysts say.
item.title: Australians to be $2850 a year worse off without quick vaccine: KPMG

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: Lifting school results in NSW is key to improving the state's weak productivity growth: report.
item.title: Making teaching more rewarding critical to improving NSW productivity

item.dc:creator: Julie Power
item.description: Staff at the aged care regulator are understaffed and lack the powers to investigate gaps in care, says its union.
item.title: Toothless: staff at aged care regulator claim they lack resources and power

item.description: With backpackers gone, should the local unemployed get priority for farm jobs?
item.title: Pandemic fallout offers chance to rethink farm labour issue

item.dc:creator: Brian Yatman
item.description: The city water supply, personal notices, and lost or strayed
item.title: In the Herald: August 21, 1880

item.description: It was the literary storm of the decade: Helen Demidenko, winner of the 1995 Miles Franklin Prize, had falsified her family history.
item.title: From the Archives 1995: Writer Demidenko revealed to be Helen Darville

item.description: Meg Bell shares her experience of starting her new job from home during the pandemic.
item.title: Work connection at home isn't just about your wifi

item.description: Trivia and word buffs: test your knowledge with today's superquiz and Target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Friday, August 21

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: There’s nothing like the scrambling of a government office when a Category 5 media storm hits.
item.title: Icare insights from the room where it happened

item.description: Let’s have a look at what it would take to try to protect those who need protecting.
item.title: Let the virus run but protect the vulnerable? Easier said than done

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, August 21, 2020

item.dc:creator: Dana McCauley
item.description: The government wrote to aged care providers in June warning they must prepare for all staff to be stood down in a COVID-19 outbreak, but was slow to provide a surge workforce.
item.title: Health department to offer carers $5000 payments to move to Melbourne

item.dc:creator: Nathanael Cooper
item.description: He has conquered the globe but the Australian singer is back at home with his family for the release of his latest EP.
item.title: Life comes full circle as Troye Sivan releases new music from his bedroom

item.dc:creator: Benjamin Preiss
item.description: Contact tracing and public health messages would be conducted locally under the Burnet Institute's proposal.
item.title: 'People want to co-operate': Institute proposes local contact tracing scheme

item.dc:creator: Melissa Cunningham
item.description: The warning comes as a major outbreak at Frankston Hospital reignites fears about the dangers of the virus spreading among medical staff working between hospitals.
item.title: One in five Victorian health workers with COVID-19 'caught it at work'

item.description: The Prime Minister will need much bigger ideas than super in the October budget.
item.title: Debate over super rise a distraction from much bigger issues

item.dc:creator: Chris Zappone
item.description: As the world addresses an authoritarian China, Russia’s influence over leaders and parties in democracies matters.
item.title: What part did the Russians play in Brexit?

item.description: Hashem Abedi, 23, had denied helping plan the attack at Manchester Arena but was found guilty of murder, attempted murder, and conspiring to cause explosions.
item.title: Brother of Manchester Arena suicide bomber sentenced over 2017 concert blast

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Maika Sivo continued his prolific tryscoring feats at Bankwest Stadium as Melbourne's injuries and potential suspensions continued.
item.title: Eels home in on top-two berth after seeing off busted Storm

item.description: A road sign that would not be out of place on the way to the Overlook.
item.title: Shake and sniff an old habit that lingers

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news

item.dc:creator: Sam McClure
item.description: Cam McCarthy has quit after being told he wouldn't be offered a contract beyond 2020.
item.title: Fremantle Docker walks out on the club

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: The finals have come early as the Eels attempt to right the ship against the Storm juggernaut. We'll have full live coverage from 7.30pm.
item.title: NRL 2020 LIVE: Parramatta Eels down Melbourne Storm 14-0

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: Essendon's Irving Mosquito will make his AFL debut with the Bombers in the Dreamtime in Darwin match against Richmond on Saturday night.
item.title: Mosquito to debut for Bombers in Darwin

item.description: The selected teams for round 13 of the 2020 AFL season, starting with Carlton v Gold Coast in Darwin on Friday night.
item.title: AFL round 13 teams and expert tips

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: Victoria recorded 216 new cases on Wednesday, its lowest daily case total in recent weeks, as mystery cases in NSW continue to concern health authorities.
item.title: As the day unfolded: Victoria records 240 new COVID-19 cases as state's hotel quarantine inquiry resumes; Australian death toll jumps to 463
